heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: The last storm was on 12 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1021 m), feels like temperature (up 5.6°C), outside temperature (up 4.3°C), and dew point temperature (up 1.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 553.3m lower than yesterday, 607.0m lower than the past week, 1021.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 939m to 3180m and averaged 1233.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
